title: Saturn Could Float
fact: Saturn is less dense than water—if you could find a bathtub big enough, it would float!

title: Infinite Galaxies
fact: There are more galaxies in the observable universe than grains of sand on Earth.

title: Fastest Object Ever
fact: The Parker Solar Probe travels at over 700,000 km/h to study the Sun.

title: Earth’s Speed
fact: Earth rotates at 1,600 km/h and orbits the Sun at 107,000 km/h—yet we feel still!

title: Neptune’s Winds
fact: Winds on Neptune can reach up to 2,100 km/h — faster than the speed of sound.

title: Moon Quakes
fact: The Moon has its own quakes, caused by tidal forces and meteor impacts.

title: Halley's Comet
fact: It only appears once every 76 years—last seen in 1986, and will return in 2061.

title: Starlight Travel Time
fact: The light from some stars takes millions of years to reach us, showing their ancient past.

title: Stardust in You
fact: Every atom in your body was formed in the heart of a star—you're literally made of stardust.

title: Space Junk
fact: There are over 27,000 pieces of tracked space debris orbiting Earth right now.

title: Black Hole Time Warp
fact: Time moves slower near a black hole—get too close and seconds could equal years elsewhere.

title: Sun’s Core Heat
fact: The core of the Sun reaches temperatures of around 15 million °C—hotter than any furnace on Earth.

title: Jupiter's Magnetosphere
fact: Jupiter’s magnetic field is 20,000 times stronger than Earth’s—it can trap radiation belts larger than Earth itself.

title: The Sky Isn’t Dark
fact: Space isn’t completely black—cosmic background radiation gives it a faint glow from the Big Bang.

title: Coldest Place in the Universe
fact: The Boomerang Nebula is the coldest known place in the universe, just 1°C above absolute zero.

title: Space Mirrors
fact: Some satellites use mirrors to focus sunlight and provide power or redirect energy—like giant space flashlights.

title: Voyager’s Golden Record
fact: Voyager 1 carries a golden record with Earth sounds, music, and greetings for any aliens who find it.

title: Space Has No Color
fact: In the vacuum of space, there's no air to scatter light—technically, space has no color and is completely black.
